title: Virtual Member Lecture: The Obama Portraits
short_description: Join Sam Ramos, educator and associate director, Innovation and Creativity, as he discusses the acclaimed Obama portraits. Featuring history-making subjects President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama and created by groundbreaking artists Kehinde Wiley and Amy Sherald, respectively, these stunning portrayals are on view at the Art Institute of Chicago for the first stop of The Obama Portraits tour.
list_description: Join Sam Ramos, educator and associate director, Innovation and Creativity, as he discusses the acclaimed Obama portraits, on view at the Art Institute of Chicago for the first stop of a five-city tour.
description:
Join Sam Ramos, educator and associate director, Innovation and Creativity, as he discusses the acclaimed Obama portraits. Featuring history-making subjects President Barack Obama and First Lady Michelle Obama and created by groundbreaking artists Kehinde Wiley and Amy Sherald, respectively, these stunning portrayals are on view at the Art Institute of Chicago for the first stop of The Obama Portraits tour.

This program will be livestreamed on YouTube and you will receive the event link when you register. We recommend using a laptop or desktop computer to enjoy this program. You can submit questions for the speakers in advance or during the program using the Google Form below. This event will also be recorded, and the recording will be available on the Art Institute's YouTube channel soon after the event.

If you have any questions about virtual programming, please reach out to museum-programs@artic.edu.

Closed captioning will be available for this program. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu. 

The Obama Portraits Tour is organized by the Smithsonian’s National Portrait Gallery, Washington, DC. 

National Sponsor
buy_button_caption:
Free, registration required

This event will be recorded, and the recording will be available on the Art Institute's YouTube channel soon after the event.
